definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
to be lost/to be ruined/to perish/to wither away
hear the wind and lose gall (idiom); terror-stricken at the news

sentences.english: Glebe's old hero bereavement, Hugh death cause.
sentences.chinese: 天荒地老英雄喪，國破家亡事業休。

sentences.english: I know that F. P. A insurance doesn't cover losses on consumer goods.
sentences.chinese: 我知道安然險不包孕斲喪品的各種喪失蹤。

sentences.english: Body counts also rise as victims die from indirect causes.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人數的上升還因爲受害者喪生於間接原因。

sentences.english: He was a linebacker on the Dallas Cowboys practice-squad who was killed in a car crash early Saturday morning.
sentences.chinese: 他是週六早晨喪生於車禍的達拉斯牛仔隊的一名球員。

sentences.english: Qing Dynasty Opium War decline, the country mourning the right of the Treaty of Nanking.
sentences.chinese: 鴉片戰爭清朝衰，南京條約喪國權。

sentences.english: Every single time you exercise more than usual- you use up calories and flocated on.
sentences.chinese: 每一次你疏通比泛泛多，你斲喪的熱量和脂肪。

definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
to put (a criminal) to death/to punish
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
